Feature_Description: Parallel embankments 50 m apart, 0.3–0.5 m high, visible in woodlot north of Newark Airport. LiDAR cross-sections show central depression.
Two linear anomalies trending NE-SW in geophysical and LiDAR data, matching projected GHR path.
West wall visible in 2006 aerials and LiDAR; east wall absent, likely due to disturbance.
1930s aerials show straight, continuous traces of parallel walls; LiDAR confirms subtle relief.
Excavation trench (124 m) reveals thickened subsoil and dip, possible wall and ditch; LiDAR shows subtle linearity.

Location: Agricultural field 5350m S of Ramp Creek
Feature_Description: Parallel lines at 27° azimuth in 1988 infrared aerial; LiDAR shows faint linear depressions.
No direct LiDAR evidence of parallel embankments, but subtle linear anomalies on outwash terrace align with projected path.
